Create your own natural cleaning products using ingredients like baking soda, vinegar, lemon juice, and essential oils. For example, make a paste of baking soda and water to scrub surfaces or create a solution of equal parts vinegar and water to use as an all-purpose cleaner.
Use old clothes or towels to clean surfaces instead of buying new ones. This can help reduce waste and save money.
Use plants as air fresheners by placing them in rooms or hanging them from hooks. Some plants, such as spider plants and peace lilies, are known for their ability to purify the air.
Practice good hygiene habits, such as washing your hands regularly, covering your mouth when coughing or sneezing, and avoiding touching your face.

Get creative with DIY beauty treatments, such as making your own facial masks using ingredients like honey, avocado, and oatmeal. You could also try using natural oils, such as coconut oil or jojoba oil, to moisturize your skin.
